info.description: This is a swagger documentation for the Midaz Transaction API
info.title: Midaz Transaction API

get.description: Returns a paginated list of organizations, optionally filtered by metadata, date range, and other criteria

parameters.description: Authorization Bearer Token with format: Bearer {token}
parameters.name: Authorization

parameters.description: JSON string to filter organizations by metadata fields
parameters.name: metadata

parameters.description: Maximum number of records to return per page
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: Filter organizations created on or after this date (format: YYYY-MM-DD)
parameters.name: start_date

parameters.description: Filter organizations created on or before this date (format: YYYY-MM-DD)
parameters.name: end_date

parameters.description: Sort direction for results based on creation date
parameters.name: sort_order

post.description: Creates a new organization with the provided details including legal name, legal document, and optional address information

parameters.description: Authorization Bearer Token with format: Bearer {token}
parameters.name: Authorization

parameters.description: Organization details including legal name, legal document, and optional address information
parameters.name: organization

head.description: Returns the total count of organizations as a header without a response body

parameters.description: Authorization Bearer Token with format: Bearer {token}
parameters.name: Authorization

204.description: No content with X-Total-Count header containing the count

get.description: Returns detailed information about an organization identified by its UUID

parameters.description: Authorization Bearer Token with format: Bearer {token}
parameters.name: Authorization

delete.description: Permanently removes an organization identified by its UUID. Note: This operation is not available in production environments.

parameters.description: Authorization Bearer Token with format: Bearer {token}
parameters.name: Authorization

403.description: Forbidden action or not permitted in production environment

409.description: Conflict: Cannot delete organization with dependent resources

patch.description: Updates an organization's information such as legal name, address, or status. Only supplied fields will be updated.

parameters.description: Authorization Bearer Token with format: Bearer {token}
parameters.name: Authorization

parameters.description: Organization fields to update. Only supplied fields will be modified.
parameters.name: organization

get.description: Returns a paginated list of ledgers within the specified organization, optionally filtered by metadata, date range, and other criteria

parameters.description: Authorization Bearer Token with format: Bearer {token}
parameters.name: Authorization

parameters.description: JSON string to filter ledgers by metadata fields
parameters.name: metadata

parameters.description: Maximum number of records to return per page
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: Filter ledgers created on or after this date (format: YYYY-MM-DD)
parameters.name: start_date

parameters.description: Filter ledgers created on or before this date (format: YYYY-MM-DD)
parameters.name: end_date

parameters.description: Sort direction for results based on creation date
parameters.name: sort_order

post.description: Creates a new ledger within the specified organization. A ledger is a financial record-keeping system for tracking assets, accounts, and transactions.

parameters.description: Authorization Bearer Token with format: Bearer {token}
parameters.name: Authorization

parameters.description: Ledger details including name, status, and optional metadata
parameters.name: ledger

head.description: Returns the total count of ledgers for a specific organization as a header without a response body

parameters.description: Authorization Bearer Token with format: Bearer {token}
parameters.name: Authorization

204.description: No content with X-Total-Count header containing the count

get.description: Returns detailed information about a ledger identified by its UUID within the specified organization

parameters.description: Authorization Bearer Token with format: Bearer {token}
parameters.name: Authorization

delete.description: Permanently removes a ledger identified by its UUID. Note: This operation is not available in production environments.

parameters.description: Authorization Bearer Token with format: Bearer {token}
parameters.name: Authorization

403.description: Forbidden action or not permitted in production environment

409.description: Conflict: Cannot delete ledger with dependent resources

patch.description: Updates a ledger's information such as name, status, or metadata. Only supplied fields will be updated.

parameters.description: Authorization Bearer Token with format: Bearer {token}
parameters.name: Authorization

parameters.description: Ledger fields to update. Only supplied fields will be modified.
parameters.name: ledger

get.description: Returns a paginated list of all account types for the specified organization and ledger, optionally filtered by metadata

parameters.description: Authorization Bearer Token with format: Bearer {token}
parameters.name: Authorization

parameters.description: JSON string to filter account types by metadata fields
parameters.name: metadata

parameters.description: Limit of account types per page (default: 10, max: 100)
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: Sort order (asc or desc, default: asc)
parameters.name: sort_order

404.description: Organization, ledger, or account types not found

post.description: Endpoint to create a new Account Type.

parameters.description: Authorization Bearer Token with format: Bearer {token}
parameters.name: Authorization

409.description: Conflict - account type key value already exists

parameters.name: Authorization

parameters.description: Account Type ID in UUID format

Account.description: Complete account entity containing all fields including system-generated fields like ID, creation timestamps, and metadata. This is the response format for account operations. Accounts represent individual financial entities (bank accounts, cards, expense categories, etc.) within a ledger and are the primary structures for tracking balances and transactions.

alias.description:
Unique alias for the account (makes referencing easier)
example: @treasury_checking
maxLength: 100

assetCode.description:
Asset code associated with this account (determines currency/asset type)
example: USD
maxLength: 100

blocked.description: Indicates if the account is blocked

createdAt.description:
Timestamp when the account was created (RFC3339 format)
example: 2021-01-01T00:00:00Z
format: date-time

deletedAt.description:
Timestamp when the account was soft deleted, null if not deleted (RFC3339 format)
example: null
format: date-time

entityId.description:
Optional external identifier for linking to external systems
example: EXT-ACC-12345
maxLength: 256

id.description:
Unique identifier for the account (UUID format)
example: 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000
format: uuid

ledgerId.description:
ID of the ledger this account belongs to (UUID format)
example: 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000
format: uuid

metadata.description:
Custom key-value pairs for extending the account information
example: {"department": "Treasury", "purpose": "Operating Expenses", "region": "Global"}

name.description:
Human-readable name of the account
example: Corporate Checking Account
maxLength: 256

organizationId.description:
ID of the organization that owns this account (UUID format)
example: 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000
format: uuid

parentAccountId.description:
ID of the parent account if this is a sub-account (UUID format)
example: 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000
format: uuid

portfolioId.description:
ID of the portfolio this account belongs to (UUID format)
example: 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000
format: uuid

segmentId.description:
ID of the segment this account belongs to (UUID format)
example: 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000
format: uuid

status.description: Current operating status of the account

type.description:
Type of the account.
example: deposit

updatedAt.description:
Timestamp when the account was last updated (RFC3339 format)
example: 2021-01-01T00:00:00Z
format: date-time

createdAt.description: The timestamp when the account type was created.

deletedAt.description: The timestamp when the account type was deleted.

description.description: Detailed description of the account type.
description.example: Assets that are expected to be converted to cash within one year

id.description: The unique identifier of the Account Type.

keyValue.description: A unique key value identifier for the account type.

ledgerId.description: The unique identifier of the Ledger.

metadata.description:
Custom key-value pairs for extending the account type information
example: {"department": "Treasury", "purpose": "Operating Expenses", "region": "Global"}

name.description: The name of the account type.

organizationId.description: The unique identifier of the Organization.

updatedAt.description: The timestamp when the account type was last updated.

Address.description: Structured address information following standard postal address format. Country field follows ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 standard (2-letter country codes). Used for organization physical locations and other address needs.

city.description:
City or locality name
example: New York
maxLength: 100

country.description:
Country code in ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 format (two-letter country code)
example: US
minLength: 2
maxLength: 2

line1.description:
Primary address line (street address or PO Box)
example: 123 Financial Avenue
maxLength: 256

line2.description:
Secondary address information like apartment number, suite, or floor
example: Suite 1500
maxLength: 256

state.description:
State, province, or region name or code
example: NY
maxLength: 100

zipCode.description:
Postal code or ZIP code
example: 10001
maxLength: 20

Amount.description: Amount is the struct designed to represent the amount of an operation. Contains the value and scale (decimal places) of an operation amount.

value.description:
The amount value in the smallest unit of the asset (e.g., cents)
example: 1500
minimum: 0

Asset.description: Asset represents a financial instrument within a ledger, such as a currency, cryptocurrency, commodity, or other asset type.

code.description: Unique code/symbol for the asset (max length 100 characters)

createdAt.description: Timestamp when the asset was created

deletedAt.description: Timestamp when the asset was deleted (null if not deleted)

id.description: Unique identifier for the asset (UUID format)

ledgerId.description: ID of the ledger this asset belongs to (UUID format)

metadata.description: Additional custom attributes for the asset

name.description: Name of the asset (max length 256 characters)

organizationId.description: ID of the organization that owns this asset (UUID format)

status.description: Status of the asset (active, inactive, pending)

type.description: Type of the asset (e.g., currency, cryptocurrency, commodity, stock)

updatedAt.description: Timestamp when the asset was last updated

AssetRate.description: AssetRate is a struct designed to store asset rate data. Represents a complete asset rate entity containing conversion information between two assets, including all system-generated fields.

createdAt.description:
Timestamp when the asset rate was created
example: 2021-01-01T00:00:00Z
format: date-time

externalId.description:
External identifier for integration with third-party systems
example: 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000
format: uuid

from.description:
Source asset code
example: USD
minLength: 2
maxLength: 10

id.description:
Unique identifier for the asset rate
example: 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000
format: uuid

ledgerId.description:
Ledger containing this asset rate
example: 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000
format: uuid

metadata.description:
Additional custom attributes
example: {"provider": "Central Bank", "rateName": "Official Exchange Rate"}

organizationId.description:
Organization that owns this asset rate
example: 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000
format: uuid

scale.description:
Decimal places for the rate
example: 2
minimum: 0

source.description:
Source of rate information
example: External System
maxLength: 200

to.description:
Target asset code
example: BRL
minLength: 2
maxLength: 10

updatedAt.description:
Timestamp when the asset rate was last updated
example: 2021-01-01T00:00:00Z
format: date-time

Balance.description: Balance is the struct designed to represent the account balance. Contains available and on-hold amounts along with the scale (decimal places).

available.description:
Amount available for transactions (in the smallest unit of asset)
example: 1500
minimum: 0

onHold.description:
Amount on hold and unavailable for transactions (in the smallest unit of asset)
example: 500
minimum: 0

version.description:
Balance version after the operation
example: 2
minimum: 0

CreateAccountInput.description: Request payload for creating a new account within a ledger. Accounts represent individual financial entities such as bank accounts, credit cards, expense categories, or any other financial buckets within a ledger. Accounts are identified by a unique ID, can have aliases for easy reference, and are associated with a specific asset type.

alias.description:
Unique alias for the account (optional, must follow alias format rules)
required: false
example: @treasury_checking
maxLength: 100

assetCode.description:
Asset code that this account will use for balances and transactions
required: true
example: USD
maxLength: 100

blocked.description:
Whether the account should start blocked
required: false
default: false

entityId.description:
Optional external identifier for linking to external systems
required: false
example: EXT-ACC-12345
maxLength: 256

name.description:
Human-readable name of the account
required: false
example: Corporate Checking Account
maxLength: 256

parentAccountId.description:
ID of the parent account if this is a subaccount (optional)
required: false
format: uuid

portfolioId.description:
ID of the portfolio this account belongs to (optional)
required: false
format: uuid

segmentId.description:
ID of the segment this account belongs to (optional)
required: false
format: uuid

status.description:
Current operating status of the account
required: false

type.description:
Type of the account
required: true
example: deposit
maxLength: 256

description.description: Detailed description of the account type.
description.example: Assets that are expected to be converted to cash within one year

keyValue.description: A unique key value identifier for the account type.

name.description: The name of the account type.

CreateAdditionalBalance.description: Request payload for creating a new balance with specified permissions and custom key.

allowReceiving.description:
Whether the account should be allowed to receive funds to this balance
required: false
example: true

allowSending.description:
Whether the account should be allowed to send funds from this balance
required: false
example: true

key.description:
Unique key for the balance
required: true
maxLength: 100
example: asset-freeze

CreateAssetInput.description: CreateAssetInput is the input payload to create an asset within a ledger, such as a currency, cryptocurrency, or other financial instrument.

code.description: Unique code/symbol for the asset (required, max length 100 characters)

metadata.description:
Additional custom attributes for the asset
Keys max length: 100 characters, Values max length: 2000 characters

name.description: Name of the asset (required, max length 256 characters)

status.description: Status of the asset (active, inactive, pending)

type.description: Type of the asset (e.g., currency, cryptocurrency, commodity, stock)

CreateAssetRateInput.description: CreateAssetRateInput is the input payload to create an asset rate. Contains required fields for setting up asset conversion rates, including source and target assets, rate value, scale, and optional metadata.

externalId.description:
External identifier for integration (optional)
example: 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000
format: uuid

from.description:
Source asset code (required)
example: USD
required: true
minLength: 2
maxLength: 10

metadata.description:
Additional custom attributes (optional)
example: {"provider": "Central Bank", "rateName": "Official Exchange Rate"}

rate.description:
Conversion rate value (required)
example: 100
required: true

scale.description:
Decimal places for the rate (optional)
example: 2
minimum: 0

source.description:
Source of rate information (optional)
example: External System
maxLength: 200

to.description:
Target asset code (required)
example: BRL
required: true
minLength: 2
maxLength: 10

CreateLedgerInput.description: Request payload for creating a new ledger. Contains the ledger name (required), status, and optional metadata. Ledgers are organizational units within an organization that group related financial accounts and assets together.

name.description:
Display name of the ledger
required: true
maxLength: 256

status.description:
Current operating status of the ledger (defaults to ACTIVE if not specified)
required: false

CreateOrganizationInput.description: Request payload for creating a new organization. Contains all the necessary fields for organization creation, with required fields marked as such. Organizations are the top-level entities in the hierarchy and contain ledgers, which in turn contain accounts and assets.

address.description:
Physical address of the organization
required: false

doingBusinessAs.description:
Trading or brand name of the organization, if different from legal name
required: false
example: Lerian FS
maxLength: 256

legalDocument.description:
Official tax ID, company registration number, or other legal identification
required: true
example: 123456789012345
maxLength: 256

legalName.description:
Official legal name of the organization
required: true
example: Lerian Financial Services Ltd.
maxLength: 256

parentOrganizationId.description:
UUID of the parent organization if this is a child organization
required: false
format: uuid

status.description:
Current operating status of the organization (defaults to ACTIVE if not specified)
required: false

CreatePortfolioInput.description: CreatePortfolioInput is the input payload to create a portfolio within a ledger, representing a collection of accounts grouped for specific purposes.

entityId.description: Optional external entity identifier (max length 256 characters)

metadata.description:
Additional custom attributes for the portfolio
Keys max length: 100 characters, Values max length: 2000 characters

name.description: Name of the portfolio (required, max length 256 characters)

status.description: Status of the portfolio (active, inactive, pending)

CreateSegmentInput.description: CreateSegmentInput is the input payload to create a segment within a ledger, representing a logical division such as a business area, product line, or customer category.

metadata.description:
Additional custom attributes for the segment
Keys max length: 100 characters, Values max length: 2000 characters

name.description: Name of the segment (required, max length 256 characters)

status.description: Status of the segment (active, inactive, pending)

CreateTransactionInflowSwaggerModel.description: Schema for creating inflow transaction with the complete SendInflow operation structure defined inline

chartOfAccountsGroupName.description:
Chart of accounts group name for accounting purposes
example: FUNDING
maxLength: 256

code.description:
Transaction code for reference
example: TR12345
maxLength: 100

description.description:
Human-readable description of the transaction
example: New Inflow Transaction
maxLength: 256

metadata.description:
Additional custom attributes
example: {"reference": "TRANSACTION-001", "source": "api"}

send.description:
Send operation details including distribution only
required: true

asset.description:
Asset code for the transaction
example: USD
required: true

distribute.description:
Destination accounts and amounts for the transaction
required: true

to.description:
List of destination operations
required: true

amount.description:
Amount details for the operation
required: true

asset.description:
Asset code
example: USD
required: true

value.description:
Amount value in smallest unit
example: "100.00"
required: true

chartOfAccounts.description:
Chart of accounts code
example: FUNDING_CREDIT

description.description:
Operation description
example: Credit Operation

metadata.description:
Additional metadata
example: {"operation": "funding", "type": "account"}

value.description:
Transaction amount value in the smallest unit of the asset
example: "100.00"
required: true

transactionDate.description:
TransactionDate Period from transaction creation date until now
Example "2021-01-01T00:00:00Z"
swagger: type string
required: false

Transaction code for reference
example: TR12345

description.description:
Human-readable description of the transaction
example: New Outflow Transaction

metadata.description:
Additional custom attributes
example: {"reference": "TRANSACTION-001", "source": "api"}

pending.description:
Whether the transaction should be created in pending state
example: true

send.description:
Send operation details including source only
required: true

asset.description:
Asset code for the transaction

required: true

source.description:
Source accounts and amounts for the transaction

from.description:
List of source operations
required: true

amount.description:
Amount details for the operation
required: true

asset.description:
Asset code
example: USD
required: true

value.description:
Amount value in smallest unit
example: "100.00"
required: true

chartOfAccounts.description:
Chart of accounts code
example: WITHDRAWAL_DEBIT

description.description:
Operation description

Additional metadata

value.description:
Transaction amount value in the smallest unit of the asset

description.description: A description for the Transaction Route.

metadata.description: Additional metadata stored as JSON

operationRoutes.description: An object containing accounting data of Operation Routes from the Transaction Route.

title.description: Short text summarizing the purpose of the transaction. Used as an entry note for identification.

Error.description: Standardized error response format used across all API endpoints for error situations. Provides structured information about errors including codes, messages, and field-specific validation details.

code.description:
Error code identifying the specific error condition
example: ERR_INVALID_INPUT
maxLength: 50

entityType.description:
Optional type of entity associated with the error
example: Organization
maxLength: 100

fields.description:
Optional detailed field validations for client-side handling
example: {"name": "Field 'name' is required"}

message.description:
Detailed error message explaining the issue
example: The request contains invalid fields. Please check the field 'name' and try again.
maxLength: 500
message.example: The request contains invalid fields. Please check the field 'name' and try again.

title.description:
Short, human-readable error title
example: Bad Request
maxLength: 100

Ledger.description: Complete ledger entity containing all fields including system-generated fields like ID, creation timestamps, and metadata. This is the response format for ledger operations. Ledgers are organizational units within an organization that group related financial accounts and assets together.

createdAt.description:
Timestamp when the ledger was created (RFC3339 format)
example: 2021-01-01T00:00:00Z
format: date-time

deletedAt.description:
Timestamp when the ledger was soft deleted, null if not deleted (RFC3339 format)
example: null
format: date-time

id.description:
Unique identifier for the ledger (UUID format)
example: 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000
format: uuid

metadata.description:
Custom key-value pairs for extending the ledger information
example: {"department": "Finance", "currency": "USD", "region": "North America"}

name.description:
Display name of the ledger
example: Treasury Operations
maxLength: 256

organizationId.description:
Reference to the organization that owns this ledger (UUID format)
example: 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000
format: uuid

status.description: Current operating status of the ledger

updatedAt.description:
Timestamp when the ledger was last updated (RFC3339 format)
example: 2021-01-01T00:00:00Z
format: date-time

Operation.description: Operation is a struct designed to store operation data. Represents a financial operation that affects account balances, including details such as amount, balance before and after, transaction association, and metadata.

accountAlias.description:
Human-readable alias for the account
example: @person1
maxLength: 256

accountId.description:
Account identifier associated with this operation
example: 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000
format: uuid

assetCode.description:
Asset code for the operation
example: BRL
minLength: 2
maxLength: 10

balanceId.description:
Balance identifier affected by this operation
example: 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000
format: uuid

balanceKey.description:
Unique key for the balance
example: asset-freeze
maxLength: 100

chartOfAccounts.description:
Chart of accounts code for accounting purposes
example: 1000
maxLength: 20

createdAt.description:
Timestamp when the operation was created
example: 2021-01-01T00:00:00Z
format: date-time

deletedAt.description:
Timestamp when the operation was deleted (if soft-deleted)
example: 2021-01-01T00:00:00Z
format: date-time

description.description:
Human-readable description of the operation
example: Credit card operation
maxLength: 256

id.description:
Unique identifier for the operation
example: 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000
format: uuid

metadata.description:
Additional custom attributes
example: {"reason": "Purchase refund", "reference": "INV-12345"}

status.description: Operation status information

transactionId.description:
Parent transaction identifier
example: 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000
format: uuid

type.description:
Type of operation (e.g., DEBIT, CREDIT)
example: DEBIT
maxLength: 50

updatedAt.description:
Timestamp when the operation was last updated
example: 2021-01-01T00:00:00Z
format: date-time

code.description: External reference of the operation route.

createdAt.description: The timestamp when the operation route was created.

deletedAt.description: The timestamp when the operation route was deleted.

description.description: Detailed description of the operation route purpose and usage.
description.example: This operation route handles cash-in transactions from service charge collections

id.description: The unique identifier of the Operation Route.

ledgerId.description: The unique identifier of the Ledger.

metadata.description: Additional metadata stored as JSON

operationType.description: The type of the operation route.

organizationId.description: The unique identifier of the Organization.

title.description: Short text summarizing the purpose of the operation. Used as an entry note for identification.

updatedAt.description: The timestamp when the operation route was last updated.

Organization.description: Complete organization entity containing all fields including system-generated fields like ID, creation timestamps, and metadata. This is the response format for organization operations. Organizations are the top-level entities in the Midaz platform hierarchy.

createdAt.description:
Timestamp when the organization was created (RFC3339 format)
example: 2021-01-01T00:00:00Z
format: date-time

deletedAt.description:
Timestamp when the organization was soft deleted, null if not deleted (RFC3339 format)
example: null
format: date-time

doingBusinessAs.description:
Trading or brand name of the organization, if different from legal name
example: Lerian FS
maxLength: 256

id.description:
Unique identifier for the organization (UUID format)
example: 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000
format: uuid

legalDocument.description:
Official tax ID, company registration number, or other legal identification
example: 123456789012345
maxLength: 256

legalName.description:
Official legal name of the organization
example: Lerian Financial Services Ltd.
maxLength: 256

metadata.description:
Custom key-value pairs for extending the organization information
example: {"industry": "Financial Services", "founded": 2020, "employees": 150}

parentOrganizationId.description:
Reference to the parent organization, if this is a child organization
example: 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000
format: uuid

status.description: Current operating status of the organization

updatedAt.description:
Timestamp when the organization was last updated (RFC3339 format)
example: 2021-01-01T00:00:00Z
format: date-time

Pagination.description: Pagination is the struct designed to store the pagination data of an entity list.

Portfolio.description: Portfolio represents a collection of accounts grouped for specific purposes such as business units, departments, or client portfolios.

createdAt.description: Timestamp when the portfolio was created

deletedAt.description: Timestamp when the portfolio was deleted (null if not deleted)

entityId.description: Optional external entity identifier (max length 256 characters)

id.description: Unique identifier for the portfolio (UUID format)

ledgerId.description: ID of the ledger this portfolio belongs to (UUID format)

metadata.description: Additional custom attributes for the portfolio

name.description: Name of the portfolio (max length 256 characters)

organizationId.description: ID of the organization that owns this portfolio (UUID format)

status.description: Status of the portfolio (active, inactive, pending)

updatedAt.description: Timestamp when the portfolio was last updated

Segment.description: Segment represents a logical division within a ledger such as a business area, product line, or customer category.

createdAt.description: Timestamp when the segment was created

deletedAt.description: Timestamp when the segment was deleted (null if not deleted)

id.description: Unique identifier for the segment (UUID format)

ledgerId.description: ID of the ledger this segment belongs to (UUID format)

metadata.description: Additional custom attributes for the segment

name.description: Name of the segment (max length 256 characters)

organizationId.description: ID of the organization that owns this segment (UUID format)

status.description: Status of the segment (active, inactive, pending)

updatedAt.description: Timestamp when the segment was last updated

Status.description: Status is the struct designed to represent the status of a transaction. Contains code and optional description for transaction states.

code.description:
Status code identifying the state of the transaction
example: ACTIVE
maxLength: 100

description.description:
Optional descriptive text explaining the status
example: Active status
maxLength: 256

Transaction.description: Transaction is a struct designed to store transaction data. Represents a financial transaction that consists of multiple operations affecting account balances, including details about the transaction's status, amounts, and related operations.

amount.description:
Transaction amount value in the smallest unit of the asset
example: 1500
minimum: 0

assetCode.description:
Asset code for the transaction
example: BRL
minLength: 2
maxLength: 10

chartOfAccountsGroupName.description:
Chart of accounts group name for accounting purposes
example: Chart of accounts group name
maxLength: 256

createdAt.description:
Timestamp when the transaction was created
example: 2021-01-01T00:00:00Z
format: date-time

deletedAt.description:
Timestamp when the transaction was deleted (if soft-deleted)
example: 2021-01-01T00:00:00Z
format: date-time

description.description:
Human-readable description of the transaction
example: Transaction description
maxLength: 256

destination.description:
List of destination account aliases or identifiers
example: ["@person2"]

id.description:
Unique identifier for the transaction
example: 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000
format: uuid

metadata.description:
Additional custom attributes
example: {"purpose": "Monthly payment", "category": "Utility"}

operations.description: List of operations associated with this transaction

parentTransactionId.description:
Parent transaction identifier (for reversals or child transactions)
example: 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000
format: uuid

source.description:
List of source account aliases or identifiers
example: ["@person1"]

status.description: Transaction status information

updatedAt.description:
Timestamp when the transaction was last updated
example: 2021-01-01T00:00:00Z
format: date-time

createdAt.description: The timestamp when the transaction route was created.

deletedAt.description: The timestamp when the transaction route was deleted.

description.description: A description for the Transaction Route.

id.description: The unique identifier of the Transaction Route.

ledgerId.description: The unique identifier of the Ledger.

metadata.description: Additional metadata stored as JSON

operationRoutes.description: An object containing accounting data of Operation Routes from the Transaction Route.

organizationId.description: The unique identifier of the Organization.

title.description: Short text summarizing the purpose of the transaction. Used as an entry note for identification.

updatedAt.description: The timestamp when the transaction route was last updated.

UpdateAccountInput.description: Request payload for updating an existing account. All fields are optional - only specified fields will be updated. Omitted fields will remain unchanged. This allows partial updates to account properties such as name, status, portfolio, segment, and metadata.

blocked.description:
Whether the account should be blocked
required: false

entityId.description:
Optional external identifier for linking to external systems
required: false
example: EXT-ACC-12345
maxLength: 256

name.description:
Updated name of the account
required: false
example: Primary Corporate Checking Account
maxLength: 256

portfolioId.description:
Updated portfolio ID for the account
required: false
format: uuid

segmentId.description:
Updated segment ID for the account
required: false
format: uuid

status.description:
Updated status of the account
required: false

description.description: Detailed description of the account type.
description.example: Assets that are expected to be converted to cash within one year

name.description: The name of the account type.

UpdateAssetInput.description: UpdateAssetInput is the input payload to update an existing asset's properties such as name, status, and metadata.

metadata.description:
Updated or additional custom attributes for the asset
Keys max length: 100 characters, Values max length: 2000 characters

name.description: Updated name of the asset (optional, max length 256 characters)

status.description: Updated status of the asset (active, inactive, pending)

UpdateBalance.description: Request payload for updating an existing balance's permissions. All fields are optional - only specified fields will be updated. Omitted fields will remain unchanged.

allowReceiving.description:
Whether the account should be allowed to receive funds to this balance
required: false
example: true

allowSending.description:
Whether the account should be allowed to send funds from this balance
required: false
example: true

UpdateLedgerInput.description: Request payload for updating an existing ledger. All fields are optional - only specified fields will be updated. Omitted fields will remain unchanged.

name.description:
Updated display name of the ledger
required: false
example: Treasury Operations Global
maxLength: 256

status.description:
Updated status of the ledger
required: false

UpdateOperationInput.description: UpdateOperationInput is the input payload to update an operation. Contains fields that can be modified after an operation is created.

description.description:
Human-readable description of the operation
example: Credit card operation
maxLength: 256

metadata.description:
Additional custom attributes
example: {"reason": "Purchase refund", "reference": "INV-12345"}

code.description: External reference of the operation route.

description.description: Detailed description of the operation route purpose and usage.
description.example: This operation route handles cash-in transactions from service charge collections

metadata.description: Additional metadata stored as JSON

title.description: Short text summarizing the purpose of the operation. Used as an entry note for identification.

UpdateOrganizationInput.description: Request payload for updating an existing organization. All fields are optional - only specified fields will be updated. Omitted fields will remain unchanged.

address.description:
Updated physical address of the organization
required: false

doingBusinessAs.description:
Updated trading or brand name of the organization
required: false
example: Lerian Group
maxLength: 256

legalName.description:
Updated legal name of the organization
required: false
example: Lerian Financial Group Ltd.
maxLength: 256

parentOrganizationId.description:
Updated UUID of the parent organization if this is a child organization
required: false
format: uuid

status.description:
Updated status of the organization
required: false

UpdatePortfolioInput.description: UpdatePortfolioInput is the input payload to update an existing portfolio's properties such as name, entity ID, status, and metadata.

entityId.description: Updated external entity identifier (optional, max length 256 characters)

metadata.description:
Updated or additional custom attributes for the portfolio
Keys max length: 100 characters, Values max length: 2000 characters

name.description: Updated name of the portfolio (optional, max length 256 characters)

status.description: Updated status of the portfolio (active, inactive, pending)

UpdateSegmentInput.description: UpdateSegmentInput is the input payload to update an existing segment's properties such as name, status, and metadata.

metadata.description:
Updated or additional custom attributes for the segment
Keys max length: 100 characters, Values max length: 2000 characters

name.description: Updated name of the segment (optional, max length 256 characters)

status.description: Updated status of the segment (active, inactive, pending)

UpdateTransactionInput.description: UpdateTransactionInput is the input payload to update a transaction. Contains fields that can be modified after a transaction is created.

description.description:
Human-readable description of the transaction
example: Transaction description
maxLength: 256

metadata.description:
Additional custom attributes
example: {"purpose": "Monthly payment", "category": "Utility"}

description.description: A description for the Transaction Route.

metadata.description: Additional metadata stored as JSON

operationRoutes.description: An object containing accounting data of Operation Routes from the Transaction Route.

title.description: Short text summarizing the purpose of the transaction. Used as an entry note for identification.

Whether the transaction should be created in pending state

swagger: type boolean

send.description:
Send operation details including source and distribution
required: true

asset.description:
Asset code for the transaction
example: USD
required: true

distribute.description:
Destination accounts and amounts for the transaction
required: true

List of destination operations
required: true

amount.description:
Amount details for the operation
required: true

asset.description:
Asset code
example: USD
required: true

value.description:
Amount value in smallest unit

Source accounts and amounts for the transaction

Amount details for the operation

Asset code

mmodel.Balance.description: Complete balance entity containing all fields including system-generated fields like ID, creation timestamps, and metadata. This is the response format for balance operations. Balances represent the amount of a specific asset held in an account, including available and on-hold amounts.

accountId.description:
Account that holds this balance
example: 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000
format: uuid

accountType.description:
Type of account holding this balance
example: creditCard
maxLength: 50

alias.description:
Alias for the account, used for easy identification or tagging
example: @person1
maxLength: 256

allowReceiving.description:
Whether the account can receive funds to this balance
example: true

allowSending.description:
Whether the account can send funds from this balance
example: true

assetCode.description:
Asset code identifying the currency or asset type of this balance
example: USD
minLength: 2
maxLength: 10

available.description:
Amount available for transactions (in the smallest unit of the asset, e.g. cents)
example: 1500
minimum: 0

createdAt.description:
Timestamp when the balance was created (RFC3339 format)
example: 2021-01-01T00:00:00Z
format: date-time

deletedAt.description:
Timestamp when the balance was softly deleted, null if not deleted (RFC3339 format)
example: null
format: date-time

id.description:
Unique identifier for the balance (UUID format)
example: 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000
format: uuid

key.description:
Unique key for the balance
example: asset-freeze
maxLength: 100

ledgerId.description:
Ledger containing the account this balance belongs to
example: 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000
format: uuid

metadata.description:
Custom key-value pairs for extending the balance information
example: {"purpose": "Main savings", "category": "Personal"}

onHold.description:
Amount currently on hold and unavailable for transactions
example: 500
minimum: 0

organizationId.description:
Organization that owns this balance
example: 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000
format: uuid

updatedAt.description:
Timestamp when the balance was last updated (RFC3339 format)
example: 2021-01-01T00:00:00Z
format: date-time

version.description:
Optimistic concurrency control version
example: 1
minimum: 1
